entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 5:52AM AKST until December 12 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HIGHWAYS... .A storm force front in the Gulf of Alaska will bring precipitation to the panhandle. Warm, moist southerly air will lift into the cooler temperatures over the highways at higher elevations to produce moderate to heavy snow. Another front will push up from the southwest Tuesday morning which will transition

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 5:14AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow continues Monday into Wednesday for the Interior... A strong frontal boundary is bringing snow and blowing snow over the northern Interior today. Gusty northeast winds of 25 to 40 mph will reduce visibility over higher terrain north of Fairbanks and along the Elliott, Steese and Dalton highways. The second shot of snow brings a better chance of accumulating snow

entry.summary: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS FROM OCCASIONAL LIGHT SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... A Pacific system and polar cold front will bring colder air and light snow to the area starting late this afternoon.
